description: Read, write, and format data in Sheets. Programmatically create and update pivot tables, data validation, charts and more.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The client ID that you obtain from the API Console, as described in Obtain OAuth 2.0 credentials.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: The client secret that you obtain from the API Console, as described in Obtain OAuth 2.0 credentials.

args.name: code
args.info: The authorization code that is returned from the initial request.

args.name: redirectUri
args.info: The URI that you specify in the API Console, as described in Set a redirect URI.

args.name: grantType
args.info: This field must contain a value of authorization_code, as defined in the OAuth 2.0 specification.

blocks.name: updateSpreadsheet
blocks.description: Applies one or more updates to the spreadsheet.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: spreadsheetId
args.info: The spreadsheet to apply the updates to.

args.name: requests
args.info: A list of updates to apply to the spreadsheet. Requests will be applied in the order they are specified. If any request is not valid, no requests will be applied.

args.name: includeSpreadsheetInResponse
args.info: Determines if the update response should include the spreadsheet resource.

args.name: responseIncludeGridData
args.info: True if grid data should be returned. Meaningful only if if includeSpreadsheetResponse is 'true'. This parameter is ignored if a field mask was set in the request.

args.name: responseRanges
args.info: Limits the ranges included in the response spreadsheet. Meaningful only if includeSpreadsheetResponse is 'true'.

blocks.name: createSpreadsheet
blocks.description: Creates a spreadsheet, returning the newly created spreadsheet.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: properties
args.info: Overall properties of a spreadsheet.

args.name: sheets
args.info: The sheets that are part of a spreadsheet.

args.name: namedRanges
args.info: The named ranges defined in a spreadsheet.

blocks.name: getSingleSpreadsheet
blocks.description: Returns the spreadsheet at the given ID. The caller must specify the spreadsheet ID.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: spreadsheetId
args.info: The spreadsheet to request.

args.name: ranges
args.info: The ranges to retrieve from the spreadsheet.

args.name: includeGridData
args.info: True if grid data should be returned. This parameter is ignored if a field mask was set in the request.

blocks.name: copySheets
blocks.description: Copies a single sheet from a spreadsheet to another spreadsheet. Returns the properties of the newly created sheet.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: spreadsheetId
args.info: The ID of the spreadsheet containing the sheet to copy.

args.name: sheetId
args.info: The ID of the sheet to copy.

args.name: destinationSpreadsheetId
args.info: The ID of the spreadsheet to copy the sheet to.

blocks.name: appendSheetValues
blocks.description: Appends values to a spreadsheet. The input range is used to search for existing data and find a `table` within that range. Values will be appended to the next row of the table, starting with the first column of the table.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: spreadsheetId
args.info: The ID of the spreadsheet to update.

args.name: range
args.info: The A1 notation of a range to search for a logical table of data. Values will be appended after the last row of the table.

args.name: valueInputOption
args.info: How the input data should be interpreted. Must be: INPUT_VALUE_OPTION_UNSPECIFIED,RAW,USER_ENTERED

args.name: insertDataOption
args.info: How the input data should be inserted. Must be: OVERWRITE,INSERT_ROWS

args.name: includeValuesInResponse
args.info: Determines if the update response should include the values of the cells that were appended. By default, responses do not include the updated values.

args.name: responseValueRenderOption
args.info: Determines how values in the response should be rendered. Must be: FORMATTED_VALUE,UNFORMATTED_VALUE,FORMULA

args.name: responseDateTimeRenderOption
args.info: Determines how dates, times, and durations in the response should be rendered. Must be: SERIAL_NUMBER,FORMATTED_STRING

args.name: valueRange
args.info: ValueRange structure.

blocks.name: batchClear
blocks.description: Clears one or more ranges of values from a spreadsheet.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: spreadsheetId
args.info: The ID of the spreadsheet to update.

args.name: ranges
args.info: The ranges to clear, in A1 notation.

blocks.name: getBatchValues
blocks.description: Returns one or more ranges of values from a spreadsheet. The caller must specify the spreadsheet ID and one or more ranges.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: spreadsheetId
args.info: The ID of the spreadsheet to retrieve data from.

args.name: ranges
args.info: The A1 notation of the values to retrieve.

args.name: majorDimension
args.info: The major dimension that results should use. Must be: DIMENSION_UNSPECIFIED, ROWS, COLUMNS

args.name: valueRenderOption
args.info: How values should be represented in the output. Must be: FORMATTED_VALUE, UNFORMATTED_VALUE, FORMULA

args.name: dateTimeRenderOption
args.info: How dates, times, and durations should be represented in the output. Must be: SERIAL_NUMBER, FORMATTED_STRING

blocks.name: batchUpdate
blocks.description: Sets values in one or more ranges of a spreadsheet.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: spreadsheetId
args.info: The ID of the spreadsheet to update.

args.name: valueInputOption
args.info: How the input data should be interpreted. Must be: INPUT_VALUE_OPTION_UNSPECIFIED, RAW, USER_ENTERED

args.name: data
args.info: The new values to apply to the spreadsheet.

args.name: includeValuesInResponse
args.info: Determines if the update response should include the values of the cells that were updated. true or false

args.name: responseValueRenderOption
args.info: Determines how values in the response should be rendered. Must be: FORMATTED_VALUE, UNFORMATTED_VALUE, FORMULA

args.name: responseDateTimeRenderOption
args.info: Determines how dates, times, and durations in the response should be rendered. Must be: SERIAL_NUMBER, FORMATTED_STRING

blocks.name: clearValues
blocks.description: Clears values from a spreadsheet. The caller must specify the spreadsheet ID and range. Only values are cleared -- all other properties of the cell (such as formatting, data validation, etc..) are kept.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: spreadsheetId
args.info: The ID of the spreadsheet to update.

args.name: range
args.info: The A1 notation of the values to clear.

blocks.name: getRangeValues
blocks.description: Returns a range of values from a spreadsheet. The caller must specify the spreadsheet ID and a range.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: spreadsheetId
args.info: The ID of the spreadsheet to retrieve data from.

args.name: range
args.info: The A1 notation of the values to retrieve.

args.name: majorDimension
args.info: The A1 notation of the values to retrieve. Must be: DIMENSION_UNSPECIFIED, ROWS, COLUMNS

args.name: valueRenderOption
args.info: How values should be represented in the output. Must be: FORMATTED_VALUE, UNFORMATTED_VALUE, FORMULA

args.name: dateTimeRenderOption
args.info: How dates, times, and durations should be represented in the output. Must be: SERIAL_NUMBER, FORMATTED_STRING

blocks.name: updateRangeValues
blocks.description: Sets values in a range of a spreadsheet.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: spreadsheetId
args.info: The ID of the spreadsheet to update.

args.name: range
args.info: The A1 notation of the values to update.

args.name: valueInputOption
args.info: How the input data should be interpreted. Must be: INPUT_VALUE_OPTION_UNSPECIFIED, RAW, USER_ENTERED

args.name: includeValuesInResponse
args.info: Determines if the update response should include the values of the cells that were updated.

args.name: responseValueRenderOption
args.info: Determines how values in the response should be rendered. Must be: FORMATTED_VALUE, UNFORMATTED_VALUE, FORMULA

args.name: responseDateTimeRenderOption
args.info: Determines how dates, times, and durations in the response should be rendered. Must be: SERIAL_NUMBER, FORMATTED_STRING

args.name: value
args.info: Data within a range of the spreadsheet.
